episodes.title: Jonestown Survivors Spoke Out— Then They Were Killed
episodes.description:
On April 24, 1980 — just a year and a half after the Jonestown tragedy — A documentary filmmaker sat down to recount firsthand experiences of one of the most shocking mass deaths in modern history. Some of the documentary interviewees had just been murdered in the weeks leading up to this rare interview. They describe life inside the Peoples Temple, the atmosphere leading up to November 18, 1978, and the chaotic final moments as over 900 men, women, and children lost their lives in a mass murder-suicide orchestrated by Jim Jones.

This conversation provides a stark, unfiltered look at the realities of Jonestown, the psychological hold Jim Jones had over his followers, and the few desperate attempts to escape.
